instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage No Boot
threads.message:
Board came in with liquid damage around CPU mosfet and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>, Also burnt pins in the Thunderbolt port.

Removed and cleaned up the CPU mosfets and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>. Cleaned out the thunderbolt ports and It has green light switching to Orange.
Fan spins in SMC Bypass and spins in normal boot once the cpu get warm. CPU gets warm but not hot. Backlight turns on and I have LCD Power but I have no image and no chime.
Does not output anything on HDMI and does not boot to USB.
CPU mosfets both show correct power going to CPU when backlight is on. 

Is the Intel chip dead on the GPU side or is there something else that may cause these symptoms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage No Boot
threads.message: Connect an USB with a led on it and see if there is some activity, also do a PRAM reset...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage No Boot
threads.message: If there is backlight most things are working. Can you do a PRAM reset on an external USB keyboard? Disconnect the trackpad to prevent the internal keyboard from messing up.
